name: circumnavigation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of sailing all the way around something: a circumnavigation of the globe from west to east We completed our circumnavigation of the island in our little boat.
the act of travelling all the way around something: A circumnavigation of the park along excellent, clearly signposted cycle paths is 25 miles.
the act of discussing something in a lot of detail, especially in order to avoid or delay mentioning something: I'm not one of those people who think that personal topics should only be approached after long circumnavigation. See
circumnavigate
More examplesFewer examplesSir Francis Chichester made a successful solo circumnavigation of the world in 1966-77.By the time we had driven around the block, including another crazy circumnavigation of the Arc de Triomphe, the space had been filled by another car.Round we go again - our third circumnavigation - while Tom takes yet more directions over the phone from Tony Walters. While the book sets out to discuss one aspect of physics, it feels obliged to go on a circumnavigation of much of the physics of the past 100 years in order to explain the one specific aspect.
